mcq.statement: What does the idiom 'go back on one's word' mean?

options.a: To return to a previous topic of discussion
options.b: To break a promise or fail to fulfill a commitment
options.c: To repeat something one has said
options.d: To physically retreat from a situation

mcq.one_liner: The idiom 'go back on one's word' means to break a promise or fail to fulfill a commitment that one has made.
